intro: Viburnum deamii var. indianense, commonly known as the Indian viburnum, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. The plant produces red berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight. Viburnum deamii var. indianense is often cultivated for its ornamental value and adaptability to humid climates.
